# animationCurve

**Instance Property**

The timing curve for the animation.

## Declaration

```swift
var animationCurve: NSAnimation.Curve { get set }
```

## Discussion

The animation curve describes the relative frame rate over the course of the animation; predefined curves are linear, ease in (slow down near end), ease out (slowly speed up at start), and ease in-ease out (S-curve). Changing the value of this property changes the timing of an in-progress animation. The value of this property is ignored if the delegate implements the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimationDelegate/animation(_:valueForProgress:)] method.

Setting this property to an invalid value raises an exception. For a list of valid animation values, see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/Curve].

## Configuring an Animation

- **animationBlockingMode**: The blocking mode of the animation.
- **runLoopModesForAnimating**: An array of strings representing the run loop modes in which the animation can run.
- **duration**: The duration of the animation, in seconds.
- **frameRate**: The number of frame updates per second to generate for the animation.
